meanings.definition: Submit a lower bid than someone else in a competitive situation.
meanings.sent1: She decided to underbid the other company to win the contract.
meanings.sent2: The company underbid their competitors to secure the project.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky fox tried to underbid the clever rabbit in the race.
meanings.sent4: He always manages to underbid his opponents in the game of chess.
meanings.sent5: In the world of auctions, the ability to underbid effectively is crucial.

meanings.definition: Offer to do work for a lower price than someone else.
meanings.sent1: They chose to underbid the other contractors to get the job.
meanings.sent2: The handyman decided to underbid his competitors to attract more clients.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to underbid the clown in performing at the birthday party.
meanings.sent4: She underbid her colleagues to get the opportunity to work on the project.
meanings.sent5: The company's strategy was to underbid their rivals and increase their customer base.
